newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Consortium forms for Portugal gas terminal - paper.
newsitem.headline: Consortium forms for Portugal gas terminal - paper.

text.p: Portuguese state oil firm Petrogal, British Petroleum Co Plc, Mobil Corp, Royal Dutch/Shell and Borealis are negotiating the formation of a consortium to build a terminal to receive propane and butane gas in the port of Sines, Publico newspaper said.

It quoted the president of Petrogal, Manuel Ferreira de Oliveira, as saying the investment was worth 8.5 billion escudos ($48.8 million) and would double Portugal's present storage capacity for butane gas and triple storage capacity for propane gas.

The newspaper said that the terminal would respond to inroads by natural gas in the Portuguese industrial and domestic gas market since the arrival of Algerian natural gas supplies to the country earlier this year.
Petrogal spokesmen were not immediately available to comment on the report.
